channel.title: [InsidiaX] 99 cape wearing
channel.description: I want to add that you can only wear a skill cape when you are lvl 99 can someone help me with that?

item.title: [InsidiaX] 99 cape wearing
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Pure_:

The function is expecting an actual return value. Wherever you put that, check it’s return type and return an ‘error value’ (subject to interpretation).

I think he added it into the wearItem boolean in ItemAssistant.java, so he’d return false if anything.

Read full topic

item.title: [InsidiaX] 99 cape wearing
item.dc:creator: @xX4m4zingXx xX4m4zingXx
item.description:
@xX4m4zingXx wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:11, topic:540674”] int skillCapes[] = { 9747, 9753, 9750, 9768, 9756, 9759, 9762, 9801, 9807, 9783, 9798, 9804, 9780, 9795, 9792, 9774, 9771, 9777, 9786, 9810, 9765, 9948, 12169 }; int trimmedCapes[] = { 9748, 9754, 9751, 9769, 9757, 9760, 9763, 9802, 9808, 9784, 9799, 9805, 9781, 9796, 9793, 9775, 9772, 9778, 9787, 9811, 9766, 9949, 12170 }; int skillHoods[] = { 9749, 9755, 9752, 9770, 9758, 9761, 9764, 9803, 9809, 9785, 9800, 9806, 9782, 9797, 9794, 9776, 9773, 9779, 9788, 9812, 9767, 9950, 12171 }; for (int sk = 0; sk < skillCapes.length - 1; sk++) { if (c.wearId == skillCapes[sk] || c.wearId == trimmedCapes[sk] || c.wearId == skillHoods[sk]) { if (c.getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[sk]) < 99) { c.sendMessage("You need a 99 in this skill to wear a " + c.getItems().getItemName(c.wearId) + "."); return; } } }

Found that code in WearItem.java in some source I downloaded at one point. Hope it helps.[/quote]
if i exactly add that code i get 100 errors
if i add some brackets i get 1 error:

src\server\model\items\ItemAssistant.java:1619: error: missing return value return; ^

Read full topic

item.title: [InsidiaX] 99 cape wearing
item.dc:creator: @Coldmedicine Coldmedicine
item.description:
@Coldmedicine wrote:

Omg,
How is the system supposed to know what he means with the method if he didn’t declare it?
I find your comments bullshit, i’m trying to help the guy out.

Go look in player.java and find the requirement methods, declare them, and add it to ItemAssistant.java

If you don’t, i wish you good luck.

Read full topic

src\server\model\items\ItemAssistant.java:1604: error: illegal initializer for i nt int skillCapes = {9747, 9748, 9750, 9751, 9753, 9754, 9756, 9757, 9759, 9760, 9762, 9763, 9765, 9766, 9948, 9949, 9768, 9769, 97 71, 9772, 9774, 9775, 9777, 9778, 9780, 9781, 9783, 9784, 9786, 9787, 12169, 121 70, 9792, 9793, 9795, 9796, 18508, 18509, 19709, 9798, 9799, 9801, 9802, 9804, 9 805, 9807, 9808, 9810, 9811}; ^ src\server\model\items\ItemAssistant.java:1606: error: incompatible types if (c.wearId = skillCapes) { ^ required: boolean found: int src\server\model\items\ItemAssistant.java:1607: error: cannot find symbol if (c.playerLevel(c.playerXP[Ski llIds]) < 126) { ^ symbol: method playerLevel(int) location: variable c of type Client Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. item.title: [InsidiaX] 99 cape wearing
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

		int skillCapes[] = { 9747, 9753, 9750, 9768, 9756, 9759, 9762, 9801,
				9807, 9783, 9798, 9804, 9780, 9795, 9792, 9774, 9771, 9777,
				9786, 9810, 9765, 9948, 12169 };
		int trimmedCapes[] = { 9748, 9754, 9751, 9769, 9757, 9760, 9763, 9802,
				9808, 9784, 9799, 9805, 9781, 9796, 9793, 9775, 9772, 9778,
				9787, 9811, 9766, 9949, 12170 };
		int skillHoods[] = { 9749, 9755, 9752, 9770, 9758, 9761, 9764, 9803,
				9809, 9785, 9800, 9806, 9782, 9797, 9794, 9776, 9773, 9779,
				9788, 9812, 9767, 9950, 12171 };
		for (int sk = 0; sk < skillCapes.length - 1; sk++) {
			if (c.wearId == skillCapes[sk] || c.wearId == trimmedCapes[sk]
					|| c.wearId == skillHoods[sk]) {
				if (c.getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[sk]) < 99) {
					c.sendMessage("You need a 99 in this skill to wear a "
							+ c.getItems().getItemName(c.wearId) + ".");
					return;
				}
			}
		}

Found that code in WearItem.java in some source I downloaded at one point. Hope it helps.

Read full topic

item.title: [InsidiaX] 99 cape wearing
item.dc:creator: @cammyPVPftw cammyPVPftw
item.description:
@cammyPVPftw wrote:

It’s actually in itemassistant.java and this is an example method that i used.
[spoiler]if(Server.itemHandler.ItemList[wearID].req[4] > 0) { if(c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[4]) < Server.itemHandler.ItemList[wearID].req[4]) { c.sendMessage("You need a range level of "+Server.itemHandler.ItemList[wearID].req[4]+" to wear this item."); canWearItem = false; } }[/spoiler]

Read full topic
